command: dism /Mount-Image /ImageFile:C:\images\install_clean.wim /Index:1 /MountDir:C:\Mount\Base; dism /Mount-Image /ImageFile:C:\images\install_mod.wim /Index:1 /MountDir:C:\Mount\Win; Copy-Item -Path C:\staging\maldrv.sys -Destination C:\Mount\Win\Windows\System32\drivers\maldrv.sys -Force; $b=(Get-FileHash C:\Mount\Base\Windows\System32\drivers\maldrv.sys -Algorithm SHA256 -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue).Hash; $m=(Get-FileHash C:\Mount\Win\Windows\System32\drivers\maldrv.sys -Algorithm SHA256 -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue).Hash; Compare-Object @($b) @($m)
explanation: Injects a driver into the offline system image and compares SHA256 hashes versus the clean baseline to validate the unauthorized addition.
rationale_steps: Mount both baseline and target images with DISM (requires Administrator).
Copy a driver into the modified image's drivers directory.
Compute and Compare-Object the file hashes to confirm divergence.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with proper PowerShell syntax, balanced quotes, valid DISM parameters, correct semicolon separators, and proper variable assignments and method calls.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1601 (Modify System Image) by mounting two Windows images, injecting a malicious driver into one image, and comparing file hashes to verify the modification was successful.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using correct syntax for DISM and PowerShell cmdlets, proper parameter usage, and valid command separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fails to achieve its stated intent under the claimed 'Privilege: None' because mounting WIM images and modifying system directories within them strictly require administrator privileges.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command chain is well-formed with valid DISM flags, proper semicolon separators, and balanced expressions.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It mounts WIMs and copies a driver into the mounted image and compares results, but omits committing changes back to the image and incorrectly claims no privileges are needed, reducing operational realism for T1601.
